titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: S. Simon & S. Jude, Tuesday, October 28

body.p: I celebrated in the Cathedral at 8 a.m. Mr Bothamly came to talk about his crusade against the sale of improper literature at a stall in the market. He bored me inexpressibly! He is surely the most incompetent crusader that ever donned the Cross! He stayed to lunch.
I spent most of the afternoon at a meeting of the Council of the Durham Colleges – very dull.
Then Freeman came with his list of suppliant widows, and I appointed two of them to receive the emolument belonging to the status of a "Church Widow".
Then the Precentor came to talk over music for Christmas.
After dinner I dictated a number of letters.
